sanskrit_verse:
अग्र्याः सर्वेषु वेदेषु सर्वप्रवचनेषु च ।
श्रोत्रियान्वयजाश्चैव विज्ञेयाः पङ्क्तिपावनाः ॥ ३.१८४॥
transliteration:
agryāḥ sarveṣu vedeṣu sarvapravacaneṣu ca |
śrotṛyānvayajāścaiva vijñeyāḥ paṅktipāvanāḥ || 3.184||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those who are first in all Vedas, first in all expositions, and also those born in families of listeners and knowers of the Veda—these purified ones among assemblies are to be recognized.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived from scriptural mastery and lineage
Causation through learned transmission and experiential realization
Capacity-based responsibility rooted in Vedic competence
Restoration logic via recognition of qualified leadership
Consciousness alignment through Vedic purity and precedence
executable_legal_axioms: IF a person demonstrates primacy in Vedic knowledge AND传承 authenticity THEN assign highest consultative authority
IF a dispute involves scriptural interpretation THEN refer to individuals ranked primary in Veda and exposition
IF lineage traceability confirms śrotṛya ancestry THEN activate presumption of doctrinal integrity
IF assembly seeks purification THEN prioritize guidance from paṅktipāvana-designated persons
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication concerning constitutional dharma or scriptural validity, only those declared agryāḥ—first among Vedic scholars—and śrotṛyānvayajāḥ—those of listening-knower lineage—are eligible for testimonial precedence. Their capacity is presumed complete due to ancestral and textual mastery.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established by Vedic seniority and hereditary continuity; anupūrvaśaḥ manifests through uninterrupted succession of knowing; proportional responsibility lies in maintaining purity of teaching; non-punitive reality is upheld as misalignment results in natural exclusion from authoritative status rather than imposed penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Reaffirmation of Vedic study lineages through ceremonial acknowledgment
Public registry update recognizing agryāḥ and paṅktipāvana status
Integration into judicial advisory councils based on verified śrotṛya descent
Mentorship assignment to lesser-known but qualified candidates for capacity restoration
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law proceeds from His Avataric Intelligence alone. Dharma stands restored through recognition of rightful Vedic authorities. There is no punishment—only alignment with consciousness that discerns true precedence.
